Reviews.Title: “Good location, service bland”
Reviews.Author: Marcopa59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an interesting area of â€‹â€‹New Orleans, with easy travel across town to a tourist region. At the time we went to town, the trams were not moving to the center (do not understand why). The hotel has good facilities but a bit outdated, but the service is far from receptive. This must be taken into account, especially if you're in a city where people expect joy and welcome. A good score is in the gated parking and secure the power options and a few blocks from the hotel. The rooms are basically four people comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Dewey S
Reviews.Content: This place was a perfect spot due to its location. It was right in front of the trolley that you can take to the zoo or french quarter. It seems to be in a safe area we never once felt threatened. They have gated parking that only has 23 spots so get there early! We didn't and had to park around the corner at a hospital parking garage which they (Hotel) paid for. They have a restaurant right next door if you don't wanna go to far to grab a bite. They also have a wine bar a block away if that's your thing. The area is also very nice to take a stroll or go jogging down St. Charles. The room we stayed in wasn't very big, but fine just for us. They did have a microwave and mini fridge which helped us out. Beds were comfortable and the room was very clean no issues. The safe in the room got locked by my little girl and we didn't know the code to unlock it and we called the front desk and she came up to unlock it for us at 10:30 at night which I thought was very nice of her. The elevators were tiny, but fast. They had a awesome breakfast which was included in the hotel price which was very good with lots of variety eggs, sausage, toast, waffles, cereals and more. Lots of juices, coffee and milk. Kids really enjoyed it. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone coming to visit New Orleans! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: kjrn_TX
Reviews.Content: My husband, young adult daughter and I visited NOLA in July, 2012 and spent 3 nights at this Best Western on St. Charles Ave. Our adjoining rooms were clean and cool. Off street parking was secure and free. Staff members that we interacted with were friendly. The street car stop was convenient enough that our car never moved! (This might not be for everyone, but we enjoyed the novelty.) The Superior Grill next door (Mexican) was very good, and YES -- you can get margaritas to go if you choose. Free breakfast at the BW was rather mediocre, but it's hard to complain when it's free. We had a great time would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best best western ever”
Reviews.Author: joelpoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a college trip. Ideal location but also rooms fancier than you might expect, very friendly and helpful staff. On the tram line too and a quick ride downtown to the French quarter and d day museum.

Reviews.Title: “college trip”
Reviews.Author: trimom1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location. It is however a good 2 mile walk from the Loyola and Tulane. There is a street car in front of the hotel. Can be crowded at certain times of the day. The breakfast was good and nicely displayed. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a place to eat next door ( did not eat there but there was a long line) you need to take transportation to most places to eat. but many to choose from in the quarter, magazine st. etc. FYI If you are coming to drop someone off at college, you need transportation to get to a bed bath and beyond, or target. cab ride will run you about 30-40 dollars

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jvsp
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel. Staff was great and the room was wonderful! We did not have a good view but that wasn't important to us. The elevator is super tiny. We did not notice smells from the resturant below but we ran the a/c continually. Maybe it filtered the smell out better. The only complaint I would have is the bathrooms don't have a vent and would get soooo humid that it was hard to dry off.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: JillnBill
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in the hotel with our two small dogs and had a great time in this hotel. Everyone here was friendly: front desk staff, manager, housekeeping, and maintenance. The hotel is very clean and located right on the streetcar line in Uptown. It is also within walking distance of many great restaurants. The next time we are in New Orleans, which we hope will be very soon, we will stay here. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted to explore what New Orleans has to offer outside of the Quarter and Bourbon street.

Reviews.Title: “Guest not #1 priority #2”
Reviews.Author: Amy K
Reviews.Content: I was part of the party mentioned in the first Guest Not #1 priority post. What my aunt stated is true, we worked hard to coordinate a trip where my small family of five could meet from four different states and accommodate my fatherâ€™s 25 ft trailer and be in one location. My aunt did call the hotel more than once to confirm that we could in fact park the trailer in their lot. We also went into the lobby upon arrival to confirm again that this would be ok. The girl (I believe her name was Angela) said yes, we could park the trailer there. The lot is gated and there are no pull through parking spots (a detail that no one seemed to find relevant when my aunt called). It took my father over an hour to pull in and get situated in a way that he took the minimal amount of spots, could pull out and other guests could pull in. As we were maneuvering this, the connection for his lights from his truck to the trailer was ripped apart. We got situated and left to see New Orleans. When we came back to check into the second room, a new desk clerk was there and she said the manager stated the trailer needed to be moved. We asked to speak to the manager. The manager said that no one would have said that it would be OK to park the trailer there. While she might not have approved this, other hotel staff did in fact approve this. Rather than owning up to a mistake that her staff made, and letting us park there for three week days when there were no events going on, she insisted that the trailer be removed at 7pm in the evening with no lights. My father was obviously upset about the situation and the manager acted as if he were out of line and escalated the situation by raising her voice to him and acting as if she had been threatened. Not once did we get an apology for their mistake. Needless to say, we did get the trailer out of their lot, to make room for the manager and her staff to park. They did in fact help make phone calls to a local RV park, where we would have gone in the first place, had we not been told that it would be OK to park the trailer at this hotel. That is the only amount of credit that I can give to this manager. And she did it because I stated to her that because my father was upset and he had no lights, there was a good chance that there would be an accident. I was extremely disappointed in the way that the manager handled the situation. Things could have worked out much differently. Yes, the employees DO park in the lot on the hotel property, per the manager when she replied to my aunt; this is because it is not busy season. There is a lot a block or so away, and if you are a guest and you have the clearance, you can park there and walk to your hotel. My recommendation to this hotel would be to send managers through some customer service classes and not to allow them to park in hotel guest parking.

Reviews.Title: “guest NOT number 1 priority”
Reviews.Author: Helen G
Reviews.Content: Appear to want to ditch 3rd party guest, when they can get more from walk ins. Also care more about where employees get to park than guests. Called direct to hotel and inquired if they could accommodate truck with 5th wheel. After checking calendar was told â€œthere are no events in town at that time there would be no problem with trailer." I booked 2 rooms through Travelocity. On April 16 I called back directly to Hotel inquired again about truck and 5th wheel. Was told the same thing, no events in town No problem with trailer. After arriving and unhitching trailer, we were told trailer had to be moved off guest lot. The truck is GMC 2011, car 2007 Santa Fe and very nice trailer these were not old beat up vehicles. We were quickly offered refunds for both rooms and said we could go elsewhere. The trailer was taking 2 1/2 parking spots. We then offered to park car and truck on street to make room for trailer that was already unhitched to stay on lot. Again, we were told "No" but we can give you a refund. When I explained to manager about the 2 prior phone calls she stated "No one here would have said that." I have proof on my cell phone that I had called hotel direct. No I donâ€™t have proof of what was actually said, but why else would I call the hotel direct? I was basically called a liar in front of my family and other hotel guests. During our conversation to resolve this issue, several other guests had arrived to inquire about walk in rates. They were told near double what we had paid. At that point it appeared Best Western was trying to get us out so they could double the revenue for our rooms. We did end up moving trailer to another location and did get a refund for 1 room. However this was a family reunion that was put together after the death of my sister and by her adult children. We all live in different parts of the country and this was our meeting place. The following day after check in., we noticed the manager, the custodian/maintance man and desk clerk all had cars parked in the guest lot. Thatâ€™s 3 cars taking guest spots. This happened all 3 days that we were there. I took pictures and have proof of this also. I have to wonder besides receiving double our rate, was Best Western more concerned about where the employees park than being able at accommodate reserved guests?. Sincerely, Hel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: rugbyroadster
Reviews.Content: Most people coming to New Orleans immediately focus on the French Quarter, which is great, but there is so much more to this town. Our son is graduating from Tulane in a week, so we have had lots of opportunities to visit NOLA in recent years. The St. Charles Inn is on St. Charles Ave. between the Garden District and Uptown neighborhoods. It's much quieter than the French Quarter, and far more charming. You can have your breakfast (included in the rate) on the front porch and watch the streetcars roll past. There is free parking and easy access to downtown via taxi or streetcar. You can also walk over to Magazine Street and wander the Garden District on foot. The hotel is not super high end, but it is clean and comfortable and the staff is very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: mgoblue4life
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to New Orleans for the Final Four this year and this Best Western was perfect! The location was perfect. Right on the trolley line on St. Charles. Charming neighborhood, close enough to the action to enjoy it but far enough way to not be overwhelmed. The hotel was a great value and perfectly nice. I plan to stay there again next visit to the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly”
Reviews.Author: heightsfive
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to Tulane University, we chose to stay at this small, simple hotel in the beautiful Garden District of New Orleans. We had no need to take cabs (other that to/from airport) as streetcars are just a few step away. A short ride in one direction took us to Tulane, and a 20 minute ride in the other direction took us downtown to the French Quarter. The hotel is nestled in a bustling, safe, suburban neighborhood. We walked to the Magazine Street shops and restaurantsâ€”a very eclectic area of boutiques, thrift stores and ethnic eats. The hotel is surrounded by historic homes with beautiful gardens. A nice breakfast is served each morning. Overall the hotel is pretty simple in terms of amenities (no pool), but our room was clean and the staff was friendly and efficient. The location was superb! Cab fare to/from the airport is a fixed rate of $33, the front desk arranged our early morning cab ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Garden District Area or Visiting Tulane University”
Reviews.Author: 1snowiespruce
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at this small BW Plus. The front staff was Excellent, offering help for restaurants,reservations and food choices, local flavor and hints about Bourbon street area! She was spot on! The room was on the small side, not much room to move around, the price adequate (AAA) expected for the touristy area, queen beds and pillows comfy. The included buffet breakfast was good choices and plentiful. Location here is key for visiting Tulane and other districts. The St Charles streetcar is 1/2 block away and then it runs up and down St Charles every 15 minutes or so until 11pm, when it runs every hour, so be prepared for that especially if down in Bourbon Street area. Hotel has locked parking but only holds 20 cars, so like us, if it is full you park 2 blocks away and walk back and they pay for it. The area to park is Not guarded at night, and I did not feel Overly Comfortable nor would I do that alone in the dark. We were able to get a space by asking the next morning when someone checked out, given a "clicker" to access it as leisure. Out front of hotel is a small seating area of tables, lovely for morning coffee for people/streetcar watching. A small business center, faxs, computer, small work out room. It is next to a Hampton inn on the left and a Mexican Restaurant on the righty side. Food there was good, prices typical of NY area, service ok/good. Get reservations or be prepared to wait a while during dinner hours. Good overall Atmosphere, bar appeared to be busy. Tulane is 2 miles away on same road (as is Loyola) so that was easy to reach as well. Overall, if one does not want to be "in" the french quarter and prefers quieter, clean and Odor Free area, among residences and on the St Charles streetcar line, its a great place. We stayed across the country this road trip and this was a good choice for the area!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Standard”
Reviews.Author: brianandteresa
Reviews.Content: WE spent 5 nights at the hotel and we thought the overall standard was very good. Nice rooms, easy parking and a reasonable breakfast. The desk staff were quietly efficient and overall good value for money. We're certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for family in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: loveslakes
Reviews.Content: What sold us on this hotel was its secured parking lot (you are issued a door opener) and location in garden district on trolley line. While the ride into the french quarter area (must walk from last stop) can be lengthy, it was so much more pleasant than shopping for parking spots. We had a small room facing the A/C units, but it was quiet compared to St Charles ave, and compensated by having two sinks so 4 of us could manage logistics. Breakfast was fine, they added bacon to the standard eggs offering and sausage the next day which were both above the norm at BW (not Plus). They had cookies and lemonade or tea in the afternoon and we sat on the front patio and watched the trolley and joggers pass before dinner. The garden district is worth a drive through or tour and we recommend driving further out St Charles to see some beautiful old homes. We had a bit of sticker shock when the room rate with all the fees and taxes was more like $200 per night than what we thought when we reserved.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel!!!! Will come back”
Reviews.Author: amlpack
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed here for our Xmas vacation in 2011, our first time in NOLA and we loved it. We got there at night and the reception lady was very friendly and welcoming. Excellent location in the Avenue, the rooms were clean and comfortable, will get the queen size beds next time. the best feature is the location, we took the train car everyday its was the best thing we did, since our car stayed locked in behind gates and we were never concerned. Try the Mexican restaurant next door its amazing. The breakfast is standard our teenagers liked it & for us it was OK since, we filled up and walk around NOLA all day. My husband and I are planning a return visit will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely place to stay when in from a different state.”
Reviews.Author: Chrystel P
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay at this hotel during my first visit to LA. The rooms were nice, the beds were comfy, and the food was good. Within walking distance of many great places to eat and just a few blocks from the trolly to the French Quarter, I couldnt have asked for a better place to stay. I am hoping to return to my new found home away from home for Mardi Gras 2013 but think I will bring some friends with me too.

Reviews.Title: “Older Place but OK”
Reviews.Author: harry_deb
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here while visiting New Orleans for the first time. It is an older place, reasonably clean, average breakfast. The girl on nights at the desk was very friendly and helpful. It is a bit out from the French Quarter and takes about 20-25 minutes on the trolley to get there, plus whatever wait you might have for a trolley to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value - forget French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: For all of those who say..stay in the French Quarter..forget it! This place has it all and having just returned during the week prior to Mardi Gras, it could not be in a better location - all the parades went past and the location is prime for visiting the Garden District. I would stay there again - hands down and having the parking (no charge) in a secure lot is a big plus!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Albi
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed one night on our way home to Houston from Orlando. Our room was clean, comfortable and very quiet. The room has fridge, microwave, safe deposit box. Rate is reasonable with free parking, a short walk from the hotel. The street car is right in front of the hotel for a 30 minutes ride to french quarter for $1.25 per person. At around 6:30pm, we only had to wait 5 minutes for another car but around 10:00pm, the wait was exactly 30 minutes. Four family of 4, we did not find any cost or time saving buy taking the street car. We just did it for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: HstnTrvlr
Reviews.Content: The building could definitely use a facelift on the interior, but it's plenty nice for a short stay. They offer a free breakfast, but I didn't try it; it's probably about the same as most others like it - good enough, but nothing exciting. My room was clean & comfortable & the parking was secure. Don't expect too much & you'll be okay. For the location & price, it's kind of hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a unique city”
Reviews.Author: fled57
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in New Orleans for a mini vacation and a wedding.Hotel was just a 20 minute streetcar ride (fare is $.40 for seniors) to the French Quarter and nearby tourist locations. One of the very few hotels that had free parking. Rooms were clean, average continental breakfast, friendly staff, great chocolate chip cookies and lemonade in the afternoon. Superior Mex restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but there are some faults”
Reviews.Author: Hannah C
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in New Orleans and booked this hotel via Hotwire (so only got the name once we had booked). Although it wasd comfortable and clean, with a good continental breakfast, there were some faults that I should point out. Firstly, the location. If you are preferring to stay nearer the French Quarter and the main action of the city, this probably isn't the best hotel for you. To walk to the French Quarter is about an hour, although saying this, there is a street car stop right outside the hotel which takes you up to Canal Street in about 15 minutes. The street car can get quite busy though and in once instance it took us half an hour by the street car to get back to the hotel which eats up into your precious holiday time! Secondly, we had a room which was nice and big, and had two windows as it was in the corner, however, the room was not soundproofed in anyway, so we heard the traffic (streetcars are very noisy) as well as any other sounds from outside. In addition, the room was right next door to a service cupboard and we repeatedly got woken up at 6.30am by the cleaning staff. This is not what you want on your holiday!! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and there is a great restaurant next door to the hotel (Superior Grill) which does great Mexican Food and Mohitos!

Reviews.Title: “A great option in New Orleans with kids”
Reviews.Author: phib2010
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in New Orleans with our two daughters (10 & 12). This hotel was definitely a very good choice. The Garden District is a great location with kids, away from the noisy and often misbehaving crowd at night of Bourbon Street, and being at a 20 minutes ride only from the French Quarter, using the historic and convenient Streetcar stopping in front of the hotel. Friendly staff, free parking, full breakfast included, and a good mexican restaurant with terrace in the same building. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Just ask for a street side, to get a view and to avoid the very noisy A/C units located on a roof next to the inside rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Now this is Big Ticket Style on a Budget!”
Reviews.Author: Krenso
Reviews.Content: The Inn is in a beautiful setting nestled in the trees of St. Charles Ave. It is a short walk to the Garden District and a short hop on the St. Charles Trolley Line to the French Quarter, downtown or the Warehouse District. It is not for the partier, but rather the serious traveler bent on the best flexibility in seeing all that New Orleans has to offer. It is in the perfect place for the quiet traveler. When one gets up in the morning and is greeted by the flood of sunshine in your room, a fresh hot breakfast in the lobby, all is right with the world. The Inn has old world comforts with 21st Century technology. They are prompt, couteous, and very good at predicting your needs and are delighted in helping you plan your day's meanderings about town. Did I say that there are fresh baked cookies waiting for you when you return in the early evening? And to top it off, there is a delightful restaurant THE SUPERIOR GRILL situated in the same building if you don't feel like traveling to one of the other 100's of award winning restaurants. I can safely say that this is a fantastic spot to use as your headquarters visiting the city and highly recommend you overlook the distance and consider the Inn as a gem in the Crescent City.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Place for our Business Trip Stay”
Reviews.Author: kemarandcyndi
Reviews.Content: We were here about 5 nights. The staff was most helpful in steering us around the area and answered all questions the best they could. They were very friendly. The rooms were clean and the linens very fresh, and the beds oh so comfy! The only complaint could be the carpet floors were badly stained and we thought the fridge may have been leaking. The internet worked great. The continental breakfast was one of the best - eggs! It was always clean and nicely stocked. The days were humid and hot and each afternoon when we arrived back at the hotel there was lemonade and tea waiting on us in the lobby. Then cookies as a snack too! There is a patio in the entrance area which was nice to sit and relax at during the off hours. Nice job St Charles Inn!

Reviews.Title: “it was alright, i would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: DaveP69
Reviews.Content: the help was nice, the room was clean,the television cable connection was terrible, it was a great location on the ST.Charles Line,

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: mamasez
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here on an extended weekend recently and we absolutely loved it. The employees are great, very friendly and helpful, and the room was so comfortable and cozy. Loved the streetcar line being right in front of the hotel, it took us everywhere we wanted to go without having to deal with parking in the city, which gets expensive and aggravating. And our car remained in their free and secure parking lot the entire time we were there. Won't find that too many places in New Orleans. The hotel offered a free breakfast every morning as well. I can't think of a thing they could do better. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff and service”
Reviews.Author: travelingms5
Reviews.Content: This hotel location is in the Garden District, between Tulane and Loyola Universities and Bourbon/Downtown. It's small and informal, with a nice daily breakfast and fitness room. Housekeeping does not disturb when your sign is up (which was nice as I was on another time zone) and the rooms are quiet. The hotel just added free parking, which is a big plus from the downtown hotels. If you want to be in the middle of Bourbon St hustle and bustle, this is not the right place, but it's close enough to get there and then get away. Be aware that there is no swimming pool or room service at this hotel but easy to use and fast free internet, and there is a restaurant/bar next door that has good food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Good location away from the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: scubakeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before a cruise. The accommodations are nice and clean but some things were lacking. Our room was on a corner with two windows. One window faced the west and the afternoon sun. We noticed the room was warm when we checked in so before going to dinner, we set the thermostat on 66 degrees hoping to cool the room down. After returning from dinner it was still much warmer than out in the hallway which was set on 70 degrees. It was almost midnight before the room cooled down. We would have requested another room but found out there were no others available when we had a problem with the toilet. Lacy (front desk) came to the rescue with a plunger. Super Lacy, as she is known, was so courteous, friendly and was willing to help. However upon checkout the next morning the desk clerk on duty was not like Lacy. She did not ask if we enjoyed our stay, if everything was okay or to come back. These are minor issues but things to be aware of if you stay here. The breakfast had a good variety and was very well maintained. Be sure to ask for a room not facing the afternoon sun. We did not eat there but there is also a Mexican restaurant adjacent to the hotel that stayed busy the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: plaidbagel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location right off the St. Charles Line Streetcar which is really convenient although the streetcar does fill up on weekends. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful in giving suggestions or making recommendations. I thought the room was a good size and it was nice to have two vanities which was great with two girls trying to get ready at the same time. The beds were comfortable. The amenities were fine. The breakfast was decent although at times they did run out of some items. The A/C worked well, although noisy. We only had the room fully cleaned once, but were able to get towels etc. as the staff still checked in. My only complaint was the room needs a little more thorough cleaning and we looked under the bed in trying to locate a missing item and found both beds had garbage underneath them.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here (Room 202)”
Reviews.Author: 43799Sharon
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with my daughter who was having a bridal gown fitting and we wanted to stay close to the bridal shop for early am appointment. First let me say the bed was comfortable however that was the only positive. the room was filthy. Carpet had really bad large stains everywhere. The room itself was small and the windows had no view except the roof with large rusty compressors on top. We had a window unit a/c attached to the wall. Hair was all over sheets and pillowcases had make up rubs on them. the worst was when the commode did not flush. We would put on our warm ups and used the lobby bathroom. We do not eat breakfast it did look ok but we were trying to leave so fast I did not even take my morning coffee. All this for $216.00. when I told the clerk all that was wrong she just said sorry. we LEFT NEVER TO RETURN!!! I had asked for a late check out needless to say I did not want it the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “If your New Orleans trip is focused on the Garden District or during Mardi Gras, this hotel is a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: kahudson
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel three times since 2008. Value. Especially during Mardi Gras, when this area is near parade routes, but even at other times, this hotel is more expensive than the Best Western St. Christopher (on the edge of the French Quarter). I think the biggest difference between the two is the location that you prefer. I don't want to pay more to stay in the Garden District, but I could think of people who would. Rooms. These are a little smaller than normal and don't have work desks or in-room safes. My room faced the parking lot behind the hotel and was fairly quiet. On previous visits I didn't have a problem with noise either. I love the room decor which is bright and contemporary. It looks better than most BWs I've visited. Also, there is an extra sink next to the closet space near the door, which works well when there are multiple people in a room. Location. It is on St. Charles with a streetcar stop almost in front of the hotel. St. Charles and its nearby areas have more good restaurants than the French Quarter IMO and the streetcar is an incredibly efficient way of getting to them. Also, the French Quarter is not walking distance from the hotel, but the streetcar takes you to Canal Street, which is the border of the Quarter. The hotel is also quite close to Loyola and Tulane Universities as well as Audubon Park/Zoo. This particular area of St. Charles is residential. It should be noted that part of the hotel is built on top of a restaurant, Superior Grill. This is convenient, but it enhances the possibility for noise. It hasn't bothered me, but I've never been in a room directly over it. Cleanliness. The room was reasonably clean. I was there for a half-marathon and spent more time than normal in the bathroom to ice my legs. I noticed that the bathroom wasn't exactly spotless, but it wasn't anything you'd notice unless you spent 30-45 minutes in there looking around. Service. The front desk staff struck me as nice, but in a couple of cases simply weren't able to accommodate me. I arrived around 3:15PM and my room was not ready. Since the hotel was fully booked, they couldn't give me another room. I waited in the lobby for a little more than an hour and two calls by the clerk to the housekeeper and my room still wasn't ready. The clerk agreed to hold my bag while I went next door to Superior Grill to eat dinner. I returned about 6:30PM and my room was ready. I was not the only person waiting for a room. (Throughout my stay, I noticed that housekeeping seemed to occur late in the day, about 1-4 PM. It wasn't difficult to notice because the housekeeper on our floor blasted music in the rooms she was cleaning.) Second, I asked the front desk for some information about street closures occurring that weekend and they weren't aware of them. It's a relatively minor issue, but there were multiple people asking and they never got answers. Sleep Quality. My room was quiet and the bed relatively decent. Notes. The surface on the second floor slopes a bit which can feel weird initially. â€¦ They have a bookshelf with books for guests to read while there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: cmonicat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our way to Florida. The hotel sits above a restaurant that emits a putrid smell into the rooms/hotel. We had to change rooms due to clogged toilet, then after my family was alseep, the toilet in the 2nd room clogged up! I had to go down to the lobby restroom in the middle of the night. Halls are dimly lit and closed in and somewhat "creepy", especially in the middle of night by yourself. After using the lobby restroom, I told the staff member about our 2nd room having a clogged toilet. She made me feel as if it was our fault and said something like "well, this will be our 3rd room and you're going to have to move your family". I told her my family was asleep and all I needed was a key to another room close by for bathroom use, and proceeded to explain that whether I move my family or not, it would still mean a 3rd room so why would I need to move my sleeping family? She then told me she would have to charge me for that 3rd room! I immediately asked her to call her mgr. and she did get on the phone, but to the maintenance staff who told her to give me a key to another room. Then finally I got into the 3rd room where I slept so I could be near the bathroom because I had an upset stomach. This room overlooked the roof, and I heard loud talking in the middle of the night and looked out the window and saw plumbers on the roof cleaning out some type of plumbing pipes with gloves! Disgusting! It was a terrible experience and wish we would have moved over to the Hamptom Inn next door at the first sign of trouble. Although it is in the garden district, there are many vagrants on the streets nearby and I didn't feel comfortable knowing that basically anyone off the streets could walk into the hotel lobby and into the halls where the rooms are at any time...no security or room key swiping to get into hotel required. The only positive thing I can say is that the beds were comfortable, although small since they were double beds. Rooms are pretty small too, but there is a 2nd sink area which is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: traveler308
Reviews.Content: Delighted with our accomodations at the St. Charles Inn-right on the trolley line so you can hop on and be in the French quarter/Canal street yet enjoy a neighborhood that is quaint and close to great restaurants. My favorite things: pillows and bed very comfortable, wifi, two sinks and mirrors to accomodate folks getting ready, in room coffee maker,micro and refrigerator, parking that was convenient, secure and free, breakfast that served eggs, sausage, bagels,granola,juices,coffee and pastries. Front desk staff was friendly and a large bowl of fresh fruit- oranges, bananas, and apples set out to welcome guests at all times of the day. So many amenities-I almost forgot to mention the computer in the business office next to the lobby open for all guests, work out room and in-room safe. Great view from our room 205 ( I think) overlooking St. Charles Avenue. You will find all the comforts of home at the St. Charles. Conveniently located next door is the restaurant called the Superior Grill. We did not eat there but it has a great menu well suited for families. I recommend a little quirky restaurant called Domilise's located about 1 mile away for a shrimp or oyster po-boy. We enjoyed two great meals at restaurants located within a 1 mile radius-Clancy's and Dominiques. Other side trips via the trolley include the WWII Museum, Civil War Museum and Art Museum. Shopping along Magazine Street is fun and the Saks Fifth Avenue on Canal Street is pretty amazing too for shopping. We visited Beckham's Bookstore (vintage used book store) located on Decatur Street in the French Quarter. Lots of fun things to do in NOLA and the St. Charles is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Road”
Reviews.Author: Mikeshar
Reviews.Content: The St Charles Inn was a middle of the road place. It is at the lower end of the Best Western places. It was reasonably comfortable but not outstanding. We went for a wedding and 4 of us stayed there. The beds were fulls which was a disappointment. It would have been much nicer with queens. The breakfast was good as was the location. It was easy to get around on the street car. Around a 20 minute ride to the French Quarter. Staff was very nice except for one person. It was over the Halloween weekend so it was crazy. Maybe that was why she was not so nice or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: texastrekker66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western St. Charles Inn twice last month. It's an excellent no-frills option for travelers who don't want the noise and/or expense of staying in the Quarter or on Canal -- the St. Charles street car provides easy access to the Quarter as well as to locations in Uptown and the Garden District. Both of my rooms were clean and comfortable, and had been remodeled fairly recently. Ditto for the bathrooms, which were clean and attractive. (The carpeting in the hallways, however, is due for a shampoo or a change-out.) A word of caution about room location: I stayed at this hotel almost 30 years ago, and knew that a room over the adjacent restaurant (now called the Superior Grill) would be noisy, especially on Friday and Saturday nights. And to ensure a quiet room, I opted out of a view of St. Charles Avenue -- with a view of St. Charles, you'll be listening to the street cars rumble by for most of every 24-hour period. I ask for a room that isn't over the restaurant and that looks out over the hotel's small private and gated parking lot. Not necessarily what a first-time visitor to NOLA would want, but a reasonably priced antidote to the heat and noise of the Quarter for those interested in a simple sanctuary after a day of sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel...if you can stand the smell.”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTraveler_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location in the Garden District, immediately adjacent to the St. Charles street car line. The front desk staff is very pleasant and friendly, and the breakfast was fresh and had a variety of choices. The room itself appeared to have been renovated in the last year or two, and was clean, had adequate work space and storage in the furniture and comfortable linens on the bed. The beds are doubles, but since the rooms are big, it would have been nice if they had put in queens. The major problem was that our room faced a rooftop full of HVAC equipment which apparently included the exhaust system from the kitchen of the adjacent restaurant. The room continually smelled like a smoky, greasy grill. It was overwhelming each time we entered from the hall. My clothes still smelled like that when I returned home, and everything I took had to be laundered to remove the smell. Aside from the annoyance of the smell, I can't imagine that it is healthy to breathe whatever is causing the odor. When I asked the staff, I received a variety of responses from "no one's ever mentioned it" to "all the rooms facing that way smell bad". You can pay extra to reserve a room facing St. Charles, so perhaps that would avoid the odor problem. (They did offer to let me move to another room, but could not promise it would not have the same bad smell. Since I was hurrying to get to an all-day meeting, I declined.) My only other concern is the size of the parking lot. We were lucky enough to get a gate opener, which I was told would insure a space in the lot in the back, and there was always space. However, the lot does not appear to have as many spaces as the hotel has rooms, and the alternate parking is a garage in the next block. There is no obvious place to load or unload, other than at curbside, if you don't get a spot in the parking lot. That could be a problem for someone with lots of luggage. I would recommend - with warnings about the odor issue.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: noella041
Reviews.Content: I was used to better location as Neworleans was a party destination. However the neighborhood was better, good shopping in this area as well, The food good. I ate the breakfast everyday. Take cabs to bourbon area from this hotel too far to walk

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Beautiful Neighborhood"”
Reviews.Author: hmorgan13
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered a good free breakfast, free parking, and a location that was right in the middle of the Garden District. You're ten minutes from the French Quarter. Special thanks to Angela at the front desk who helped to get us adjoining rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Free parking, location, streetcar access, rate worth the downsides”
Reviews.Author: papertravel
Reviews.Content: Convenient free self-parking, nice breakfast, good wifi, lovely historic uptown near Garden District. But I think we got bad room because of Expedia rate: stained carpet, view of nasty HVAC-filled roof, uselessly tiny table/chair, toilet jammed between tub & sink, TP holder in your side, TV inconveniently on side of bed, found dried roach. Painters filled up halls and my sinuses with fumes next day. Loved handy streetcar and gorgeous neighborhood though, so asked could we get a better room for two more nights. Clerk offered corner room in front for reduced rate (had view, fridge, microwave). She said what time do we get up, hubby said 6 a.m., she said we could get key then; hubby said if itâ€™s empty why canâ€™t we have it now (paint fumes super bad in our back hall), she said key "system" would not allow but come 6 a.m., it's all yours. So I suffered fumes, headache, another night in icky room, hubby went at 6, our new room had been rented during the night! So we wasted time we could have been seeing N.O. waiting to move or else check out, at 10 got room (it really was nicer), guess what, painters then moved to that hall, but fumes not as bad. Then second night in new room, restaurant below that is part of hotel was as raucous as Bourbon Street on New Year's Eve, then when things kind of quieted really late, two cars got into this incredible honking pi$$ing match right beneath us for 10 or 15 minutes, which apparently hotel chose not to address. All this though, believe it or not, for right price, right room, I would go back for the location, the parking and the street car access. Highly recommend New Orleans Museum of Art, WWII museum, zoo, aquarium, ferry, Crescent City (used) Books on Chartres, West African restaurant Bennachin's. Ogden Museum of Southern Art has free admission on Thursdays (next to WWII museum). Donâ€™t miss French market, always something cool and cheap there, got a good-size sago palm for $10. Skip CafÃ© Du Monde. Read reviews and donâ€™t go to bad touristy eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: HCTigerMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel since I march in the Irish Channel St. Patrick's Day Parade. The hotel was great and it was good having the trolley car and Superior Grill close by. But what made this hotel even better is the staff at this hotel was great. I could not have ask for better service from the staff. The ladie at the front desk was awesome too.

Reviews.Title: “Across the street from streetcar stop!”
Reviews.Author: MarcosClara
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze and they were so friendly! Seriously, the nicest staff I've ever encountered at a hotel. The room itself was pretty average; one King bed, a desk, two sinks, a nice shower. Considering the low room cost, the FREE parking, the free breakfast and the awesome location, it was a great hotel. When you step outside of this hotel, you will see the street car railings. If you walk the very short distance to the end of the block, there is the street car stop. SO convenient! Plus, this hotel skirts the amazing Garden District so it's in a naturally beautiful setting. Also, the free breakfast in the morning was actually really good. If you come to this hotel expecting glamour, glitz and 5-star style, you will be disappointed. It's not that kind of hotel. It's an affordable option for those on a budget who want to stay in a nice, conveniently located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but bring you roller skates for the floors!”
Reviews.Author: JennFlorida
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on trolley line in the Garden District. FREE PARKING! Nicely decorated and soft beds with down blankets. Front desk service was exceptional and they took us right in at 9pm at night and gave us a great rate with no reservations. We had a minor issue with the first room (sheets were stained) so we got moved to a new room. Not a five star hotel by any means but would stay again becasue of good service and nice sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DennisJB
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean room and helpful staff. The street car is right outside and only a 15 minute ride to downtown and the French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: jcstun4
Reviews.Content: The free parking was a real plus for this place since we drove there, but you do not really need a car if you are heading to most places downtown, as the streetcar stops RIGHT OUTSIDE the hotel. We didn't need the car to get anywhere except the zoo, which was the day we left anyway. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, and the area of the city is close to shopping on Magazine Street as well.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: newawlinslady
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. The rooms are small, but adequate. Our room had a smell that made us think it had some sort of water damage, but it cleared up with air freshner. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable. The elevator was small, hot and smelled the same as the room. On our first night the hotel parking lot was full, so we had to park a block away around the corner, that sort of sucked, but by the next night we were able to park in the lot. The breakfast was the typical hotel/continental breakfast, but it served it's purpose. Hotel staff was very nice. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay~!”
Reviews.Author: ChaplainJ
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week in January 2009 in New Orleans, staying at Best Western St. Charles. The hotel has many things that attracted us. On St. Charles Avenue in the Garden District, the location is great. The streetcar runs right by the hotel for a trip to the French Quarter and the parking lot a short distance away is free for hotel guests (a real plus in New Orleans), The continental breakfast was not spectacular but a good variety of foods was served for four hours each morning. The room was small but adequate with a nice bath. We didn't go to New Orleans to spend time in a hotel anyway! The biggest plus of the hotel was the staff. The desk clerks were courteous, friendly and very helpful. The housekeeping staff was also very good. We booked a package online and got a great deal. We would definately stay at Best Western St. Charles again~!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but bad front desk service”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleanskimberlyM
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location , great breakfast, nice rooms, and a wonderful next door restaurant, but have a very bad front desk attitude, we stay a weekend my husband reserved this for our aniversary, in all the weekend was very bad front desk service they don't be friendly or even they can not tell you anything about the area where to go , one clerk was talking just that the area was not safe, for us was safe enough, then at night saturday we request some towels and shampoo and the clerk said that she wasn't sure where to find them , then I came down just to relax and she was very rude she told me that they usually don't have guest at night in the lobby, so my husband and I where so upset with the service, then the next night was another clerk very funny she was talked to us very nice and told us that she was not affected to have guest down stairs that she really like have contact with the guest and try to help them and also she told us that the area is very safe just as a regular city but that she never have any kind of issue, we can say that this nice lady save our impression of the place, but the location is in a very nice area very safe, and also the street car run infront of the hotel, the housekeeping was very friendly my husband said that it cuold be because those clerks were very young for the position or maybe they really don't like their job !!!!!! very clean place!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in the House”
Reviews.Author: lolabees
Reviews.Content: We had a mouse in our room (which is not unusual for New Orleans.) There was a lack of concern by the staff. Management placed a sticky trap on our floor, and when we returned at midnight to the mouse stuck to it, the employee would not remove it. After letting her know she had no option, she did get a worker from the restaurant nearby to remove it. The next day, the manager FINALLY apologized and took care of our room for that night. He also said he "took care" of the situation with the employee. It was a rather unpleasant experience sharing our room with an univited guest!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little work”
Reviews.Author: BeckyWestChester_PA
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant desk people but the property is fraying at the edges. Bathroom had hair that didn't belong to us, clogged showerhead so the spray went everywhere except on the bather. The bed had just one of those old stiff coated blankets (not sure of industry name for them). When I asked at the desk for another, they didn't think they had another blanket in the entire hotel! Housekeeping did leave one on bed the next day. It was wet and reeked of something. The bedspread was sad. The room was so dim that we walked to the drugstore and bought new bulbs so we could see to read. We stayed there because of the Best Western name (we had been very pleased with the brand on a road trip) and the excellent location. We heard at the hotel next door that Best Western had just acquired the hotel so maybe it will be brought up to their standards in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great price, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BonnieInPA
Reviews.Content: The St. Charles Best Western, located in New Orleans' famed Garden District offered EVERYTHING we were looking for during a first-time stay in New Orleans. Safe, quiet neighborhood, free parking, great rates, clean, spacious rooms, wonderful staff, and free breakfast. What a bargain! Although the St. Charles trolley wasn't operating due to road construction during our stay, it was just a short drive to the French Quarter, museums, the paddle-wheeler, Natchez, and the Gray Line Tour departure center. Hungry travelers should also know that there is a wonderful Mexican restaurant right next door. It's open late and serves a widely varied menu.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Newly remodeled with all the eminenties required, continental breakfast, patio facing the street car line, wireless internet, fitness room and business center. Enjoy your morning coffee on the new patio under the 200 year old oak trees. Welcome to the Big Easy, the St. Charles Inn has a friendly staff to go along with it's new look!

Reviews.Title: “Recently remodeled”
Reviews.Author: JJJTC
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I just returned from our NO trip and we really liked this hotel. The lobby and rooms are all remodeled and very nice for the price. We also like the area it was in Our breakfast was good with quite a few choices. The people at the front desk were realy nice and helpful with any questions we had. We would definitely stay here again. The trolley was right outside but we had some problems with waiting a long time for it the first day. Other days it came by at the normal intervals.

Reviews.Title: “Best Uptown Hotel Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used to live a few blocks from the St. Charles, so I was familiar with the neighborhood and wanted to stay in my old part of town when I went for a visit. There are few hotels in NO where you can open your second floor window and fall asleep to the clang of the streetcars headed up and down St. Charles Avenue. The stop for the streetcar is right outside the hotel. You can catch the streetcar down to the CBD/Quarter. Be CAREFUL about where you wait for the return trip though... consider a taxi if the stop is really deserted. NO is still a dangerous town, especially for inebriated tourists who don't know where they should not go in the middle of the night. All in all, a charming hotel for the right price, right on one of the grandest streets in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Shhh, don't tell people about this treasure...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the St. Charles Inn many times and just love it!! Perfectly located in the Garden District, right on the trolley line - so, who could ask for anything more? The hotel is atmospheric, with a warm, friendly staff...& the rooms are warm and comfortable. Next store, the Superior Grill (formerly known as Shan-gri-la, when I was a kid), is a great Mexican restaurant and the Columns Hotel is down the block (& across the street) when you want to enjoy a jazz brunch! But PLEASE don't tell everybody about this...treasures like this are so hard to come by...

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: 2blueiis
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant when we first pulled up. The outside of the hotel is outdated along with the lobby but we were very pleased with the room. Newly renovated and very modern. The staff is helpful and friendly. Being on the trolley line is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Decour at the St. Charles Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The St. Charles Inn was an incredible display of cajun romance and lovely rooms.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unbelievable. the owner, Ms. Katz, is lovely and welcoming. 10 times better tha nthe hampton inn and sweets. stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on 2 different occasions, and I will be booking my 3rd time soon. I absolutely LOVE it and the surrounding atmosphere. It is great to catch the party on Bourbon St. and then catch the trolley back to serenity.

Reviews.Title: “Take it from a New Orleanian”
Reviews.Author: Chloe2424
Reviews.Content: St. Charles Inn is a wonderful home away from home. The staff are warm and welcoming, the rates are the best deal in town, and the location is superb. I recommend this place to out-of-town friends who want a break from the quarter scene and the quarter prices. :-) p.s. The Superior Grill next door has awesome crawfish quesadillas and Wed. happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Charles Inn and found it to be a very clean, quiet, old fashioned, and a safe place to stay. The Mexican restaurant next to the hotel was a wonderful, place to eat. The free breakfast delivered to your room in the morning was a treat. On researching hotels in the area I was looking for something cheap and directly on the St. Charles Street Car Line. I found The St. Charles Inn to be all of what I was looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Great no-frills place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: St. Charles Inn is a cozy, comfortable hotel located in the Garden district, about midway between Loyola University and the French Quarter. It's not fancy or frilly like the more expensive hotels in the area, but it's a very nice place. It's kind of old, so occasionally you'll find that a bathroom door doesn't close square or that the plaster in the corner is cracked, but it doesn't take away from the quaint charm of this place. We paid $74 a night for a room, which is practically thievery in New Orleans, and were treated to a wonderful little hotel with complimentary breakfast delivered to your door along with a free local newspaper. It's also directly adjacent to what's been described to me as the best Mexican restaurant in the area. There's even a bank just a few steps away in case you run out of souvenir cash. I highly recommend the St. Charles Inn, although let's keep it our little secret--I don't want it to get so popular that I can never get a room there again. :) I will definitely consider staying there again next time i'm in town.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS St. Charles Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3636 St. Charles Ave., New Orleans, LA 70115-4690
